qas.question: What was the professions of Joseph Dobrovský?
What year did Joseph Dobrovský release a German-language grammar of Old Czech?
What didn't Dobrovský think Czech had a chance of returning as?
What did Josef Jungmann advocate for?
Who disagree about whether the revivalists were motivated by nationalism or if they considered contemporary spoken Czech unsuitable for formal use?

plausible_answers.text: Ausführliches Lehrgebäude der böhmischen Sprache (Comprehensive Doctrine of the Bohemian Language)

qas.question: What was the title of the book released by Josef Jungmann?
In what year did Josef Jungmann write his book?
What had Josef Jungmann intended his book to be?
Did Josef Jungmann think German would return as a major language?
What kind of revival was called for by Josef Dobrovsky?

context: During the revival, in <a1_0><b6_0>1809<b6_0/><a1_0/> <a0_0>linguist and historian<a0_0/> Josef Dobrovský released a German-language grammar of Old Czech entitled <b5_0>Ausführliches Lehrgebäude der böhmischen Sprache (Comprehensive Doctrine of the Bohemian Language)<b5_0/>. Dobrovský had intended his book to be <b7_0>descriptive<b7_0/>, and <b8_0>did not<b8_0/> think Czech had a realistic chance of returning as <a2_0>a major language<a2_0/>. However, Josef Jungmann and other revivalists used Dobrovský's book to advocate for <a3_0><b9_0>a Czech linguistic revival<b9_0/><a3_0/>. Changes during this time included spelling reform (notably, í in place of the former j and j in place of g), the use of t (rather than ti) to end infinitive verbs and the non-capitalization of nouns (which had been a late borrowing from German). These changes differentiated Czech from Slovak. <a4_0>Modern scholars<a4_0/> disagree about whether the conservative revivalists were motivated by nationalism or considered contemporary spoken Czech unsuitable for formal, widespread use.
